main event: An unidentified aircraft was sighted near Clark Air Force Base, Philippines in November 1948. The observed object was described as snow white and estimated to be 250 feet in length with a wingspan of 100 to 150 feet. It was reported to be exceedingly fast, maneuverable, and appeared to leave an exhaust trail.
interesting points: The observed object was estimated to be 250 feet in length with a wingspan of 100 to 150 feet, highlighting its massive size.
The object was reported to be exceedingly fast, faster than any jet plane observed, and showed high maneuverability, flying in and out of clouds, and making no definite heading.
The witness claimed to have heard a single roar from the object, suggestive of an engine noise similar to that of a single plane in the sky.
The report mentioned that the sighting occurred under scattered cloud conditions with a visibility of 30 miles, providing additional contextual details.
Evaluation of the incident led to an initial conclusion of C-3, indicating an unexplained or unidentified status for the reported object.
sighted object: an unidentified aircraft described as snow white, 250 feet in length with a wingspan of 100 to 150 feet
